Frequently Asked Questions
What is a credit card?
A credit card is a financial tool issued by banks that allows you to borrow money up to a predetermined limit to make purchases or withdraw cash. The borrowed amount must be repaid by the due date, either in full or through instalments, with interest applicable on outstanding balances. Credit cards also offer various benefits such as rewards, cashback, and travel perks.
What is a cashback credit card?
A cashback credit card rewards you with a percentage of your spending in the form of cash rebates. For example, if a card offers 5% cashback on groceries, you receive Ó´ü¬†5 back for every Ó´ü¬†100 spent. Cashback cards in the UAE often have specific categories like fuel, dining, or online shopping where higher cashback rates apply.
What is balance transfer in a credit card?
A balance transfer lets you move credit card debt to a lower-interest card for easier repayment.

Difference between a debit and a credit card?
Debit Card:
Linked directly to your bank account, deducting funds instantly when you make a transaction. You can only spend what you have in your account.
Credit Card:
Allows you to borrow money from the bank up to a set limit. You need to repay the borrowed amount later, either fully or in installments, with potential interest charges.

Difference between a debit and a credit card?
Debit Card:
Linked directly to your bank account, deducting funds instantly when you make a transaction. You can only spend what you have in your account.
Credit Card:
Allows you to borrow money from the bank up to a set limit. You need to repay the borrowed amount later, either fully or in installments, with potential interest charges.
How does a credit card work?
A credit card allows you to make purchases or withdraw cash using borrowed funds, which you need to repay within the billing cycle. If you pay the full amount before the due date, no interest is charged. However, if you carry forward a balance, interest will apply. Credit cards in the UAE also offer features like installment plans, reward points, and international spending capabilities.

What are people asking?
What is Balance Conversion?
Balance Conversion is an Installment Plan that allows you to convert your Credit Card retail balance into manageable monthly payments.
Who can apply for Balance Conversion?
Any Emirates NBD primary Credit Cardholder with a minimum retail outstanding balance of Ó´ü¬†1,000 can apply.
Are there any application charges for a Balance Conversion plan?
Fees are charged on the plan and are subject to change on periodic basis. There‚Äôs more information
here
.
Can I cancel my Balance Conversion plan and will I be charged?
Yes, you can cancel at any time. A foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding and 5% VAT, will apply. To cancel, call us on
600 54 0000
(UAE) or
+971 600 54 0000
internationally.
Are there any early settlement charges?
Yes, if you settle early, a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT, will apply.
What is Balance Conversion?
Balance Conversion is an Installment Plan that allows you to convert your Credit Card retail balance into manageable monthly payments.
Who can apply for Balance Conversion?

.

How long will it take to process my Balance Conversion request?
Your request will be processed instantly and will be reflected on your next Credit Card statement.
How long do I have to repay the amount I convert to a Balance Conversion plan?
You can choose to pay back over 12, 18, 24, 36, or 48 months.
Is there a minimum transaction amount to apply for a Balance Conversion plan?
Yes, you need to have a minimum retail outstanding balance of Ó´ü¬†1,000 to apply for a Balance Conversion plan on your Credit Card.
What happens if I fail to repay an installment on a Balance Conversion plan?
If you fail to make payments, your Balance Conversion plan will automatically be foreclosed. The full outstanding balance will be due immediately, and regular finance charges will apply to the remaining amount.
Can I change the tenure on an existing Balance Conversion plan?
No, but you can foreclose your plan by paying a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT, then rebook  the remaining balance into a new plan you wish to select.
What are the benefits of Balance Conversion on my Credit Card?
With a Balance Conversion plan, you can repay your credit card outstanding balance comfortably in equal monthly installments at a reducing interest rate. You have the flexibility to repay over 12 to 48 months.
What is the interest rate for a Balance Conversion plan?
Balance Conversion interest is a reducing monthly interest rate determined by Emirates NBD and shall be charged on the converted amount. The interest rates are subject to changes on periodic basis and is also based on Card usage and overall performance.
Can supplementary cardholders apply for Balance Conversion?
This facility is available for transactions done on both Primary and Supplementary Cards. However, only Primary Cardholders can raise a balance conversion request.
What happens to the Balance Conversion plan if I prepay what I owe?
Even if you prepay the full amount, your plan will remain active until you request cancellation by calling us on
600 54 0000
(UAE) or
+971 600 54 0000
internationally. Once you call and cancel, a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding and 5% VAT, will apply.
What happens if I close my Credit Card while I have a Balance Conversion plan?
Active Balance Conversion plans must be foreclosed first and then your credit card cancellation request can be processed. Foreclosure fees will apply.
Do I earn or lose reward points on my Card when converting transactions to Balance Conversion?
No, you won‚Äôt lose any reward points on transactions that are converted to a Balance Conversion plan.

What are people asking?
What is a Balance Transfer?
A Balance Transfer (BT) allows you to transfer outstanding  balances from another bank‚Äôs credit card to your Emirates NBD Credit Card,  converting them into an easy installment plan with lower interest rates.
If you don‚Äôt have an Emirates NBD Credit Card, you can
apply
for one now and then transfer your balance from another bank to us.
Who can apply for a Balance Transfer?
All primary Emirates NBD Credit Cardholders can apply for Balance Transfers.
Anyone who doesn‚Äôt have an Emirates NBD Credit Card, can
apply
for one and then ask for a Balance Transfer.
What is the maximum amount I can transfer to Emirates NBD under a Balance Transfer?
You can transfer up to 90% of your available credit limit, subject to eligibility and the available balance on your card.
Can I cancel my Balance Transfer early?
Yes, you can cancel or prepay your Balance Transfer by contacting
600 54 0000
(UAE) or
+971 600 54 0000
, internationally.
An early settlement fee of 1% of the outstanding principal plus 5% VAT will apply.
Are there any early settlement charges?
Yes, if you settle your Balance Transfer early, a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT, will apply for each plan.
What is a Balance Transfer?
A Balance Transfer (BT) allows you to transfer outstanding  balances from another bank‚Äôs credit card to your Emirates NBD Credit Card,  converting them into an easy installment plan with lower interest rates.
If you don‚Äôt have an Emirates NBD Credit Card, you can
apply
for one now and then transfer your balance from another bank to us.
Who can apply for a Balance Transfer?
All primary Emirates NBD Credit Cardholders can apply for Balance Transfers.
Anyone who doesn‚Äôt have an Emirates NBD Credit Card, can
apply
for one and then ask for a Balance Transfer.
What is the maximum amount I can transfer to Emirates NBD under a Balance Transfer?
You can transfer up to 90% of your available credit limit, subject to eligibility and the available balance on your card.
Can I cancel my Balance Transfer early?
Yes, you can cancel or prepay your Balance Transfer by contacting
600 54 0000
(UAE) or
+971 600 54 0000
, internationally.
An early settlement fee of 1% of the outstanding principal plus 5% VAT will apply.
Are there any early settlement charges?
Yes, if you settle your Balance Transfer early, a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT, will apply for each plan.
What are the charges for a Balance Transfer?
Fees are determined by Emirates NBD and can change from  time to time. Read more
here
.
What is the interest rate on a Balance Transfer?
Interest is charged on a reducing monthly basis and is determined by Emirates NBD based on card usage and overall performance. Rates are subject to change from time to time.
How do I apply for a Balance Transfer?
Just SMS ‚Äò
BT
‚Äô to
4456
or call our 24/7 helpline on
600 54 0000
or
+971 600 54 0000
, internationally.
How long does it take to process a Balance Transfer?
Your request will be processed within 5-7 working days, after which the amount you have transferred will reflect on your Credit Card statement.
How long can I take to repay a Credit Card balance I have transferred to Emirates NBD?
You can choose to repay installments over 12, 18, 24, 36 or 48 months.
Is there a minimum amount to apply for a Balance Transfer?
Yes, you need to transfer a minimum of Ó´ü¬†1,000 for a Balance Transfer.
What happens if I fail to make payments on my Balance Transfer?
If you fail to make payments, your Balance Transfer plan will be foreclosed, and the entire outstanding balance including any foreclosure fees will be due immediately, along with regular finance charges.
Can I change my existing Balance Transfer plan?
No, but you can foreclose your plan by paying a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT, then rebook the remaining balance into a new plan you wish to select.
What happens if I prepay what I owe for my Balance Transfer?
If you prepay intending to cancel the plan, you will need to contact our call center at
600 54 0000
(UAE) or
+971 600 54 0000
, internationally.
The prepayment will be adjusted towards your outstanding balance and a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT will apply.
What happens if I close my Credit Card while I have a Balance Transfer plan?
Active Balance Transfer plans must be foreclosed first and then your credit card cancellation request can be processed. Foreclosure fees will apply.

In a given statement cycle, Miles can be earned for eligible spends up to the credit limit, or Ó´ü¬†100,000 for Skywards Infinite Card / Ó´ü¬†50,000 for Skywards Signature Card, whichever is lower. Miles will be awarded for eligible transactions in chronological order up to the credit limit or above stated cap, whichever¬†is lower.
Retail spends
Grocery and supermarkets, fast food restaurants, insurance, car dealership earn 25% of domestic spends*
Petroleum, transit, government services, utility payments, real estate, education & telecommunications payments earn 10% of the domestic spends*
Duty free, online food delivery and car booking apps
Domestic and international Duty free spends, domestic online food delivery and car booking apps spends earn 2 Miles per USD equivalent; spend on Skywards Infinite Card. 1.5 Miles per USD equivalent spend on Skywards Signature Card
International spends
Spends made abroad on groceries and supermarkets, insurance, car dealerships, fast food, real estate, education, petrol, government services and utility payments including telecom, earn Miles as per normal international spends.
Retail spends on merchants in the EU earn 50% of the international spends.
Express Miles
Cardholders enrolled in the ‚Äò50% more Express Miles every month programme‚Äô are eligible to earn Express Miles. This is subject to a maximum of 4,000 additional Miles per statement. A nominal monthly fee of Ó´ü¬†250 is charged for the Express Miles programme. The listed annual fee of Ó´ü¬†1,500 is waived from the 2nd year onwards for cardholders enrolled into the Express Miles Programme. Bonus Miles for spends on
www.emirates.ae
are excluded for Express Miles calculation.

Free rides on Dubai Ferry
Experience the scenic sites and greatest landmarks of Dubai
The Dubai Ferry takes round trips on the waterfront route providing incredible views of landmarks such as Old Bastakiya, Gold Souk, Jumeirah beach, World Islands, Burj Al Arab and others and is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities.
Your Go4it Card entitles you and one accompanying guest to a free ride on the Dubai Ferry.
The exclusive rides for Go4it Cardholders are as per the below schedule.

Experience the scenic sites and greatest landmarks of Dubai
The Dubai Ferry takes round trips on the waterfront route providing incredible views of landmarks such as Old Bastakiya, Gold Souk, Jumeirah beach, World Islands, Burj Al Arab and others and is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities.
Your Go4it Card entitles you and one accompanying guest to a free ride on the Dubai Ferry.

What are people asking?
How long will it take to process my installment request?
Your request will be processed instantly and will be reflected on your next Credit Card statement.
How long do I have to repay the amount I convert to an installment plan?
You can choose to pay back over 12, 18, 24, 36 or 48 months.
What happens if I miss a monthly installment?
If you miss a monthly payment, your installment plan will automatically be foreclosed. The full outstanding balance will be due immediately including foreclosure fees, and regular finance charges will apply to the remaining amount.
Can I cancel my Installment Plan, and will I be charged?
Yes, you can cancel at any time. A foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding and 5% VAT, will apply. To cancel, call us on
600 54 0000
(UAE) or
+971 600 54 0000
internationally.
Are there any early settlement charges?
Yes, if you settle the Installment Plan early, a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT, will apply.
How long will it take to process my installment request?
Your request will be processed instantly and will be reflected on your next Credit Card statement.
How long do I have to repay the amount I convert to an installment plan?
You can choose to pay back over 12, 18, 24, 36 or 48 months.
What happens if I miss a monthly installment?
If you miss a monthly payment, your installment plan will automatically be foreclosed. The full outstanding balance will be due immediately including foreclosure fees, and regular finance charges will apply to the remaining amount.
Can I cancel my Installment Plan, and will I be charged?
Yes, you can cancel at any time. A foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding and 5% VAT, will apply. To cancel, call us on
600 54 0000
(UAE) or
+971 600 54 0000
internationally.
Are there any early settlement charges?
Yes, if you settle the Installment Plan early, a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT, will apply.
Can I change the tenure on an existing installment plan?
No, but you can foreclose your plan by paying a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT, then rebook the remaining balance into a new plan.
What is the interest rate for an installment plan?
A reducing monthly interest rate determined by Emirates NBD and charged on the principal amount, will apply. The interest rate is subject to change and is also based on Card usage and overall performance.
What happens to the Installment Plan if I prepay what I owe?
Even if you prepay the full amount, your plan will remain active until you request cancellation by calling us on
600 54 0000
(UAE) or
+971600540000
internationally. Once you call and cancel, a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding and 5% VAT, will apply.
What happens if I close my Credit Card while I have an installment plan?
All active installment plans must be foreclosed before a Credit Card cancellation request can be processed. Foreclosure fees will apply.

What are people asking?
What is an Installment Payment Plan (IPP)?
An Installment Payment Plan allows you to split your retail purchases into affordable monthly installments. It‚Äôs a smart way to manage your spending and enjoy the things you love - now.
Who can apply for an Installment Payment Plan on my Credit Card?
All Primary Emirates NBD credit cardholders can enjoy this feature.
Purchases on supplementary cards can be converted to Installment Plans too - but only the primary card holder can request it.
How can I benefit from an Installment Payment Plan?
An Installment Payment Plan offers a flexible way to pay for purchases above Ó´ü¬†750 in easy monthly installments, with interest calculated on a reducing balance. You can choose to pay over 12 to 48 months.
Are there any charges that apply for an Easy Installment Plan?
Any applicable fees on the 'IPP' facility is determined by Emirates NBD and will be charged on the plan. Fees are subject to changes on periodic basis.

for more information
What is the interest rate for an Installment Payment Plan?
A reducing monthly interest rate will apply. The interest rates are subject to changes on periodic basis and is also based on Card usage and overall performance.

How long will it take to process my Installment Payment Plan?
Your Installment Payment Plan will be processed instantly and will reflect on your card statements after that.
What are the tenure options for an Installment Payment Plan?
You can choose to repay over 12, 18, 24, 36 or 48 months.
Is there a minimum amount I need to spend on my Credit Card to apply for an Installment Payment Plan?
A retail transaction amount of AED750 is required to avail our Installment Payment Plan option on your applicable Credit Card.
Can supplementary cardholders apply for an Installment Payment Plan?
Spends on supplementary cards are eligible for Installment Plans, but only Primary Card holders can raise an IPP request.
What happens if I am unable to repay an installment?
If you miss the monthly payments, the plan will be foreclosed and the full outstanding including foreclosure fees will become due. Regular finance charges will then apply.
Can I cancel my existing Installment Payment Plan and will I be charged?
Yes, you can cancel an existing installment plan by calling us on
600 54 0000
. A foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT will apply.
Are there any early settlement charges?
Yes, a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT will be applicable.
How do I cancel my installment plan and what will happen if I prepay the amount I owe?
You need to call our contact centre on
600 54 0000
to cancel the plan. Once you call and prepay the amount, a foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT will be applied and your plan will be closed.
If you prepay the amount without calling the contact centre to cancel the plan, plan will remain active and will incur interest.
What happens if I close my Credit Card while an Installment Plan exists?
Active installment plans must be foreclosed first and then your credit card cancellation request can be processed. Foreclosure fees will apply.
Do I lose reward points when I convert my transactions to installment plans?
No, you won‚Äôt lose any reward points when you convert your transactions to installment plans with interest.
Is my transaction eligible for a 0% Installment Payment Plan?
Your transaction will be eligible if your purchase was made at one of our participating merchants.

What are people asking?
What is the Loan on Card beyond credit limit facility?
Loan on Card beyond credit limit is an installment plan that allows you to access additional cash beyond your available Credit Card limit. The loan amount can be transferred to your bank account or issued as a manager‚Äôs cheque.
Who can apply for a Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
All primary Emirates NBD Credit Cardholders can apply for a Loan on Card beyond credit limit, based on card usage and performance.
What is the maximum amount I can borrow as Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
You can borrow up to 100% of your credit card limit. The amount will vary based on your eligibility and is subject to approval.
Can I cancel my existing Loan on Card beyond credit limit plan on my Credit Card, and will I be charged?
You can prepay or foreclose your loan by contacting our call center at
600 54 0000
. A foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT will apply.
What are the repayment tenures for Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
You can choose to repay over 12, 24, 36 or 48 months.
What is the Loan on Card beyond credit limit facility?
Loan on Card beyond credit limit is an installment plan that allows you to access additional cash beyond your available Credit Card limit. The loan amount can be transferred to your bank account or issued as a manager‚Äôs cheque.
Who can apply for a Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
All primary Emirates NBD Credit Cardholders can apply for a Loan on Card beyond credit limit, based on card usage and performance.
What is the maximum amount I can borrow as Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
You can borrow up to 100% of your credit card limit. The amount will vary based on your eligibility and is subject to approval.
Can I cancel my existing Loan on Card beyond credit limit plan on my Credit Card, and will I be charged?
You can prepay or foreclose your loan by contacting our call center at
600 54 0000
. A foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT will apply.
What are the repayment tenures for Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
You can choose to repay over 12, 24, 36 or 48 months.
What are the interest rate to avail Loan on Card beyond credit limit facility?
The interest rate on Loan on Card beyond credit limit is a reducing monthly interest rate determined by Emirates NBD and shall be charged on the loan amount. The interest rates are subject to changes on periodic basis and is also based on Card usage and overall performance.
How do I apply for a Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
To apply, SMS '
ALOC
' to
4456
, or call our 24/7 customer care at
600 54 0000
. A representative will guide you through the process.
How long does it take to process a Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
Your request will be processed within 2-3 working days.
Can supplementary cardholders apply for a Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
No, only primary cardholders can apply.
Are there any charges for a Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
Any applicable fees on the Loan on Card beyond  credit limit facility is determined by Emirates NBD and will be charged on the  plan.
Fees are subject to changes on periodic  basis. Please
click here
for  more information.
Will I be eligible for reward points with a Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
No, currently, there are no reward points associated with a Loan on Card beyond credit limit.
Once I avail the Loan on Card beyond credit limit program, will my available balance increase corresponding to transaction amount placed in installments?
The Loan on Card beyond credit limit amount is over and above your credit limit, so your credit limit will not be affected by the loan amount.
How is the monthly EMI calculated for a Loan on Card beyond credit limit?
The EMI will be calculated based on the loan principal, interest for the selected tenure, and any applicable processing fees. The first EMI will include processing fee if applicable.

What are people asking?
What is a Loan on Card facility?
The (LOC) facility allows you to convert a portion of your available Credit Card limit into cash. The amount is transferred directly to your bank account or issued as a manager‚Äôs cheque.
Who can apply for a Loan on Card?
This facility is available for primary Emirates NBD credit cardholders, based on your eligibility and available credit limit.
What is the maximum amount I can borrow as a Loan on Card?
You can borrow up to 90% of your available Credit Card limit, depending on your eligibility and available credit limit.
What are the tenure options for 'Loan on Card'?
You can choose to repay your Loan on Card over 12, 18, 24, 36, or 48 months.
What is the interest rate for Loan on Card?
The interest rate is a reducing monthly rate determined by Emirates NBD and shall be charged on the loan amount. Interest rates are subject to change based on Card usage and performance.
What is a Loan on Card facility?
The (LOC) facility allows you to convert a portion of your available Credit Card limit into cash. The amount is transferred directly to your bank account or issued as a manager‚Äôs cheque.
Who can apply for a Loan on Card?
This facility is available for primary Emirates NBD credit cardholders, based on your eligibility and available credit limit.
What is the maximum amount I can borrow as a Loan on Card?
You can borrow up to 90% of your available Credit Card limit, depending on your eligibility and available credit limit.
What are the tenure options for 'Loan on Card'?
You can choose to repay your Loan on Card over 12, 18, 24, 36, or 48 months.
What is the interest rate for Loan on Card?
The interest rate is a reducing monthly rate determined by Emirates NBD and shall be charged on the loan amount. Interest rates are subject to change based on Card usage and performance.

How long will it take to process a Loan on Card?
Your Loan on Card will be processed instantly and reflected on your account and Credit Card statement.
Can supplementary cardholders apply for a Loan on Card?
No, the Loan on Card facility is available only for primary cardholders.
Are there any fees associated with the Loan on Card?
Fees for Loan on Card are determined by Emirates NBD and will be charged on the plan. Fees are subject to change. Please
click here
for more information.
Can I earn reward points on the Loan on Card?
No, currently there are no reward points associated with the Loan on Card facility.
Will my available credit limit increase as I pay off my Loan on Card?
Yes, as you repay the Loan on Card, your available Credit Card limit will increase.
How is the monthly EMI calculated?
Your monthly EMI will be the sum of the principal amount, interest for the selected tenure, and any applicable processing fee (included only in the first EMI).
Can I cancel my existing Loan on Card?
Yes, you can prepay or foreclose your Loan on Card by calling us on
600 54 0000
(UAE)  or
+971 600 54 0000
internationally.
A foreclosure fee of 1% of the principal outstanding plus 5% VAT will apply.
What happens if I prepay my Loan on Card?
Even if you prepay, your Loan on Card will remain active until you cancel the plan by calling us on
600 54 0000
(UAE) or
+971 600 54 0000
internationally. A 1% foreclosure fee plus 5% VAT will be charged on the principal outstanding.
What happens if I miss payments on my Loan on Card?
If you miss payments for two consecutive months, your plan will automatically be foreclosed. The full outstanding balance including a foreclosure fee will be due, and regular finance charges will apply.
What happens if I close my Credit Card while I have a Loan on Card?
Active Loan on Card plans must be foreclosed first and then your credit card cancellation request can be processed. Foreclosure fees will apply.

Elite Night Credits
For each calendar year, receive 15 Elite Night Credits towards the next level of Marriott Bonvoy Elite status
Elite Night Credits are the number of Qualifying Nights that you will earn when you stay at hotels participating in Marriott Bonvoy. You will earn one Elite Night Credit* (ENC) for each completed Qualifying Night.
Earning Elite Night Credits (ENCs) help you earn Elite Status.
With the 15 ENCs that you may receive from your credit card, you will only need to complete 35 Qualifying Nights to achieve Platinum Elite status, instead of 50 Qualifying Nights.

Marriott Bonvoy Points Earning
Earn 6 Marriott Bonvoy points per US$1 spent at hotels and resorts participating in Marriott Bonvoy.
1
Earn up to 3 Marriott Bonvoy points per US$1 on international spend.
2
Earn up to 3 Marriott Bonvoy points per US$1 on general domestic spend.
3
3 points per US$1 on general retail shopping (e.g. apparel, dining, etc.)
0.75 points per US$1 on grocery and supermarkets, insurance, car dealership related, and quick-service restaurants (i.e., fast-food restaurants)
4
0.30 points per US$1 on real estate, education, petroleum, government services, car-hailing services, food delivery aggregators, and bill payments (including utility and telecommunication)
Express Points Programme
Earn up to 50% more points every month for all your retail purchases on the card (subject to a maximum of 12,000 Express Points per month). You can enroll into the Express Points* programme by paying a monthly fee of AED300. Cardmembers enrolled in the Express Points programme will not be charged the annual fee.
For example, if you earn a total of 8,000 points for your domestic and international spending in a given month, then you earn Express Points as shown below:
Regular points: 8,000
Express Points: 4,000
Total points earned for the month: 12,000
1. Additional rewards: This is in addition to the points you‚Äôll earn from the loyalty programme. Please
click here
for full terms.
2. International spend is any transaction made internationally in Foreign/non-AED Currency. Spend made on merchants located in European Union and United Kingdom earn 50% of the international spend points.
3. In a given statement cycle, points can be earned for all eligible spend and will be calculated based on category of spend as defined by Mastercard. The Bank or Marriott International are not responsible for merchants categorization.
4. Spend made under the category quick service restaurants (i.e., fast-food restaurants) will earn 3 points per US$1 spent if the value of the transaction is above US$25.

Elite Night Credits
Each calendar year receive 10 Elite Night Credits towards the next level of Marriott Bonvoy Elite status
Elite Night Credits are the number of Qualifying Nights that you will earn when you stay at hotels participating in Marriott Bonvoy. You will earn one Elite Night Credit* (ENC) for each completed Qualifying Night.
Earning Elite Night Credits (ENCs) help you earn Elite Status.
With the 10 ENCs that you may receive from your Credit Card, you will only need to complete 15 Qualifying Nights to achieve Gold Elite status, instead of 25 Qualifying Nights.

Additional Free Night Award
Receive 1 Free Night Award valued at 35,000 Marriott Bonvoy points on Card anniversary
Receive an additional Free Night Award every year after your Credit Card account anniversary. Award can be used for one night (redemption level at or under 35,000 Marriott Bonvoy points) at participating hotels. Additionally, the value of your Free Night Award can be combined with up to 15,000 points to help you access even more hotels you'll love. Certain hotels have resort fees.

SKYWARDS MILES
Now your spends are your ticket to¬†more travels
Maximum eligible spends
In a given statement cycle, Miles can be earned for eligible spends up to the credit limit, or Ó´ü¬†100,000 for Skywards Infinite Card / Ó´ü¬†50,000 for Skywards Signature Card, whichever is lower. Miles will be awarded for eligible transactions in chronological order up to the credit limit or above stated cap, whichever¬†is lower.
Retail spends
Grocery and supermarkets, fast food restaurants, insurance, car dealership earn 25% of domestic spends*
Petroleum, transit, government services, utility payments, real estate, education & telecommunications payments earn 10% of the domestic spends*
Duty free, online food delivery and car booking apps
Domestic and international Duty free spends, domestic online food delivery and car booking apps spends earn 2 Miles per USD equivalent; spend on Skywards Infinite Card. 1.5 Miles per USD equivalent spend on Skywards Signature Card
International spends
Spends made abroad on groceries and supermarkets, insurance, car dealerships, fast food, real estate, education, petrol, government services and utility payments including telecom, earn Miles as per normal international spends.
Retail spends on merchants in the EU earn 50% of the international spends.
Express Miles
Cardholders enrolled in the ‚Äò50% more Express Miles every month programme‚Äô are eligible to earn Express Miles. This is subject to a maximum of 4,000 additional Miles per statement. A nominal monthly fee of Ó´ü¬†250 is charged for the Express Miles programme. The listed annual fee of Ó´ü¬†1,500 is waived from the 2nd year onwards for cardholders enrolled into the Express Miles Programme. Bonus Miles for spends on
www.emirates.ae
are excluded for Express Miles calculation.

Maximum eligible spends
In a given statement cycle, Miles can be earned for eligible spends up to the credit limit, or Ó´ü¬†100,000 for Skywards Infinite Card / Ó´ü¬†50,000 for Skywards Signature Card, whichever is lower. Miles will be awarded for eligible transactions in chronological order up to the credit limit or above stated cap, whichever¬†is lower.
Retail spends
Grocery and supermarkets, fast food restaurants, insurance, car dealership earn 25% of domestic spends*
Petroleum, transit, government services, utility payments, real estate, education & telecommunications payments earn 10% of the domestic spends*
Duty free, online food delivery and car booking apps
Domestic and international Duty free spends, domestic online food delivery and car booking apps spends earn 2 Miles per USD equivalent; spend on Skywards Infinite Card. 1.5 Miles per USD equivalent spend on Skywards Signature Card
International spends
Spends made abroad on groceries and supermarkets, insurance, car dealerships, fast food, real estate, education, petrol, government services and utility payments including telecom, earn Miles as per normal international spends.
Retail spends on merchants in the EU earn 50% of the international spends.
Express Miles
Cardholders enrolled in the ‚Äò50% more Express Miles every month programme‚Äô are eligible to earn Express Miles. This is subject to a maximum of 4,000 additional Miles per statement. A nominal monthly fee of Ó´ü¬†250 is charged for the Express Miles programme. The listed annual fee of Ó´ü¬†1,500 is waived from the 2nd year onwards for cardholders enrolled into the Express Miles Programme. Bonus Miles for spends on Emirates website are excluded for Express Miles calculation.
